Review: Solid. Made me want to watch mulholland drive

Strange and engrossing. Less stylistically inventive than the Unbelievable Truth but the story is more compelling. All redeeming characters. And the world of Simon Grimm’s Queens is completely believable. The dynamic between characters seems authentic, so much so that I kept wondering if it was the dialogue or the acting that made it seem specific and familiar at once— when you get those two adjectives together it means that the project is true (a guy I used to date would…
Spiritual cousin of the virgin suicides. Already incorporating this film into my writing.

History will say they were roommates. I really like DA Miller’s reading of this movie. His title is Anal Rope. Also, eerie to watch this movie right after finishing crime and punishment.
